message.content:
cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DC 

The paper deals with distributed cooperative decision-making in the multi-armed bandit problem, which is a well-known problem in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper proposes frequentist and Bayesian algorithms for multi-agent MAB problems, which are relevant to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), multi-agent systems (cs.MA), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), social and information networks (cs.SI), and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC).
